body_html:
This change doesn't seem to simplify the code. It's a net addition of ~70 lines and uses complicated C++ features (variadic templates).

Well, the point wasn't really to simplify the code; the point was to support mixed Tensor/TensorList arguments.

The point about avoiding refcounts is well taken; I think the requires_grad can be written more carefully. (In my local branch, I have a much cleaner write of the JIT dispatcher which correctly uses move semantics.)
body_text:
This change doesn't seem to simplify the code. It's a net addition of ~70 lines and uses complicated C++ features (variadic templates).

Well, the point wasn't really to simplify the code; the point was to support mixed Tensor/TensorList arguments.
The point about avoiding refcounts is well taken; I think the requires_grad can be written more carefully. (In my local branch, I have a much cleaner write of the JIT dispatcher which correctly uses move semantics.)
body:
> This change doesn't seem to simplify the code. It's a net addition of ~70 lines and uses complicated C++ features (variadic templates).

Well, the point wasn't really to simplify the code; the point was to support mixed Tensor/TensorList arguments.

The point about avoiding refcounts is well taken; I think the `requires_grad` can be written more carefully. (In my local branch, I have a much cleaner write of the JIT dispatcher which correctly uses move semantics.)
